title.narrative: Leaders in Innovation Fellowships Programme v2 2015-16

description.narrative: The Leaders in Innovation Fellowships programme builds technology entrepreneurship capacity of select partner country researchers who are developing a business proposition for their innovation which must meet a development challenge. Selected researchers benefit from focussed short term training and long term support through access to expert mentors and international networks.

The Newton Research Collaboration Programme aims to develop science and innovation partnerships between UK and developing countries to promote their economic development and social welfare. Awards funded through the scheme facilitate international exchanges lasting three months to a year between researchers in the UK and their counterparts in selected Newton Fund Partner Countries. Exchanges can be either one- or two-way in direction, and should form part of a collaborative research project, incorporating visits and dissemination activities. The overarching research project should constitute an internationally excellent research collaboration in any area of engineering. Applicants must demonstrate how the ultimate impacts of the research will benefit one or more developing countries in terms of social welfare improvements and economic development, as well as how the project will enhance research skills capacity in the Newton Fund partner country in identified areas of need.
